symptoms.1: 1: Yellow or chlorotic spots on leaves.
symptoms.2: 2: May be a velvety growth on spots on undersides of leaves.
symptoms.3: 3: Twisting of leaves and Distorted leaves.
symptoms.4: 4: Dark olive green spots on leaves and fruit.
symptoms.5: 5: Severely infected leaves turn yellow and drop from tree.

comments.1: 1: Fungus overwinters on dead foliage on ground.
comments.2: 2: spores dispersed by wind; high moisture encourages fungal growth.

management.1: 1: Remove all leaves dropped from tree in the fall and compost to prevent any diseases surviving in debris.
management.2: 2: Application of zinc and fertilizer grade urea in the Fall may be necessary to speed leaf drop, lime should then be added to fallen leaves.
management.3: 3: Fungicide application may be necessary in areas where leaves remain wet for periods in excess of 9 hours.
management.4: 4: Fungicides such as copper soaps and Bordeaux mixture should be applied if there is a chance of wet period as soon as leaf tips emerge.

symptoms.1: 1: Purple flecks or circular lesions which are brown in the centre and purple at margin.
symptoms.2: 2: Red flecks, purple lesions and/or brown black rings on fruit.

comments.1: 1: Spores can overwinter in twigs or fruit remaining on the tree and spread during rainfall.

management.1: 1: Remove dead wood, mummified fruit and cankers from trees to reduce spread of disease.
management.2: 2 Burn any prunings that have been made from the tree.
management.3: 3: Disease can be controlled by applying fungicides from silver tip to harvest.
